Unnamed: 1: Stockland’s ESG reporting has been prepared in accordance with the Sustainability Accounting Standards Board (SASB). This index relates to our FY23 ESG reporting and provides a guide on where information can be found as it relates to SASB reporting requirements.

Unnamed: 3: Metric
Energy consumption data coverage as a percentage of total floor area, by property subsector
(1) Total energy consumed by portfolio area with data coverage, (2) percentage grid electricity, and (3) percentage renewable, by property subsector
Like-for-like percentage change in energy consumption for the portfolio area with data coverage, by property subsector
Percentage of eligible portfolio that (1) has an energy rating and (2) is certified to ENERGY STAR, by property subsector
Unnamed: 7: Partially reported. Stockland does not operate in a market that uses ENERGY STAR ratings. The energy rating schemes we use are listed in the Asset Ratings and Certification chapter of our Environmental Management Approach. Our current energy ratings are listed in the Asset Ratings section of our Consolidated Data Pack.

Unnamed: 6: Environmental Management Approach (Asset Ratings and Certification)

Unnamed: 3: Description of how building energy management considerations are integrated into property investment analysis and operational strategy
Unnamed: 7: Partially reported. We explain how building energy management considerations support our strategic priorities related to climate, carbon and energy in our Environmental Management Approach.

Unnamed: 3: Water withdrawal data coverage as a percentage of (1) total floor area and (2) floor area in regions with High or Extremely High Baseline Water Stress, by property subsector
(1) Total water withdrawn by portfolio area with data coverage and (2) percentage in regions with High or Extremely High Baseline Water Stress, by property subsector
Unnamed: 7: Partially reported. Stockland reports on total water consumption by portfolio area in kilolitres (kL).

Unnamed: 3: Like-for-like percentage change in water withdrawn for portfolio area with data coverage, by property subsector
Description of water management risks and discussion of strategies and practices to mitigate those risks

Unnamed: 6: Environmental Management Approach (Climate Resilience, Water Management & Quality)

Unnamed: 3: (1) Percentage of new leases that contain a cost recovery clause for resource efficiency related capital improvements and (2) associated leased floor area, by property subsector
Unnamed: 5: Percentage (%) by floor area, Square feet (ft²)
Unnamed: 7: Not reported. The benefits of resource efficiency related capital improvements are shared with Stockland's tenants through billings.

Unnamed: 3: Percentage of tenants that are separately metered or submetered for (1) grid electricity consumption
Percentage of tenants that are separately metered or submetered for (2) water withdrawals, by property subsector
Discussion of approach to measuring, incentivizing, and improving sustainability impacts of tenants
Unnamed: 7: We use mandatory design requirements and other uptake schemes to enable our Masterplanned Communities residents to benefit from the savings associated with renewable energy generation and other sustainability measures.

Unnamed: 3: Area of properties located in 100-year flood zones, by property subsector
Unnamed: 7: Not reported. Our assessment of flood risk is high-level, using mapping based on long-term climate predictions. For more information, refer to the Climate Resilience and Water Management & Quality chapters in our Environmental Management Approach.

Unnamed: 3: Description of climate change risk exposure analysis, degree of systematic portfolio exposure, and strategies for mitigating risks
Number of assets, by property subsector
Leasable floor area, by property subsector
Unnamed: 7: Partially reported. Only reported for Commercial Property portfolio. Our Communities portfolio is based on number of lots and not leasable floor area.
